page.title: 17RELIGION Thornbury BRADFORD
page.content: In the last 10 years or so, many people of different ethnic origins and faiths have come to live in Thornbury. In a class of 25 children at the First School we recorded these beliefs {Christian 10 (38%), Hindu 2 (8%), {Muslim 9 (35%), Sikh 3 (11%), {Jehovah's Witness 1 (4%), Cantonese {Ancestor Worship 1 (4%). }Family origins were as follows: 5 from India, 11 Great Britain, 9 Pakistan, 1 South China. This reflects the multi-ethnic population of the area. Here is what come children said:{"I am a Sikh.}I go to the Temple on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. I go with my family. I sit on the carpet and I pray to God." {"I am a Muslim.}At home we pray to God every day. My aunties come to read in my house. I bring in fruit and they eat it. Then I bring a glass of water and milk. They drink and pass it on."
